solution_line_template: Ned has gone up {seconds_spent_running} / {time_per_flight} = <<{seconds_spent_running}/{time_per_flight}={flights_climbed}>>{flights_climbed} flights of stairs.
Thus, he has {total_flights} - {flights_climbed} = <<{total_flights}-{flights_climbed}={remaining_flights}>>{remaining_flights} flights of stairs left to run up.

He will spend {remaining_flights} * {time_per_flight} = <<{remaining_flights}*{time_per_flight}={time_for_remaining_flights}>>{time_for_remaining_flights} seconds running up the remaining stairs to the bomb.
Therefore, he will have {initial_bomb_timer} - {time_for_remaining_flights} = <<{initial_bomb_timer}-{time_for_remaining_flights}={time_to_diffuse}>>{time_to_diffuse} seconds to defuse the bomb.
